intro: Elionurus glaber, commonly known as the smooth elionurus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and smooth, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a circular pattern. Elionurus glaber is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
